title: Historic moment for New York as Zohran Mamdani sworn in | ABC NEWS
description: New York City has made history with the swearing-in of its new mayor, Zohran Mamdani, who is the first Muslim and South Asian mayor, as well as the youngest in over a century. In his inauguration address, he promised to maintain his ambitious agenda and usher in a new era for the city. title: Pet owner's warning as dogs fall ill after beach visit amid algal bloom crisis | ABC NEWS
description: Border collies Lucy and Ella fell ill and began "reverse sneezing" after a visit to Adelaide's Silver Sands beach on Monday.  Owner Katie Wahlheim says the waters were clear and did not appear to be affected by the ongoing algal bloom.  Authorities say it is safe to bring dogs to the beach, but not to let them eat dead fish or swim in foamy or discoloured water. title: WA police searching for snorkeller missing off Ledge Point Beach | ABC NEWS
description: Authorities are searching for a snorkeller missing since yesterday afternoon off Ledge Point Beach, over 100 kilometres north of Perth. The 32-year-old man was last seen around 3pm while diving for crayfish with a group from Perth. Water Police and additional resources have been dispatched to assist in the search. title: Unique "mugging" behaviour attracts whale watchers to Hervey Bay | ABC NEWS
description: "Mugging" is a common sight for whale watchers in Hervey Bay, where humpback whales encircle a vessel and interact with the people on board. Marine scientists are allaying concerns the whales' interaction with humans could be harmful, saying the behaviour instead enriches their social development. title: Jurassic Park fan fulfils childhood dream of recreating Jeep | ABC NEWS
description: Adelaide man Zakary Weyer has turned a childhood dream into a reality by building his very own Jurassic Park Jeep.  He joins a global community dedicated to recreating the vehicles that appeared in the 1993 blockbuster film.  Mr Weyer says he frequently receives photo requests from strangers when he drives his replica. title: Homes out of reach as wages fail to keep pace | Finance Report | ABC NEWS
description: The cost of homes has risen far more than the wages people use to pay for them. Whether you look at household income or wages, what's clear is that since tax changes super charged the market around the year 2000, it's been getting harder and harder to afford housing. Meanwhile, the first day of trading on the Australian share market for 2026 saw the All Ordinaries rise by 0.2%. title: Nation's biggest employer groups support royal commission into Bondi attack | ABC NEWS
description: There has been a major push from Australia's business community for the federal government to call a royal commission in the wake of the Bondi terror attack. Billionaires, former Reserve Bank governors, company chairs and major employer groups are now among those urging the prime minister to take a different approach to get answers. Political reporter Romy Stephens has the story. title: Safety expert explains how Swiss nightclub fire turned catastrophic | ABC NEWS
description: An investigation is underway into what caused a catastrophic nightclub fire that killed at least 40 people in a popular Swiss ski resort. Urban risk researcher Milad Haghani explains how the fire likely spread in a flashover or backdraft, accelerated by flammable materials in an enclosed area. title: An Australian among the injured at Swiss ski resort fire that's killed dozens | ABC NEWS
description: Dozens of people have been killed after a fire ripped through a crowded bar during New Year's celebrations in Switzerland. An Australian is confirmed to be one of the 115 injured at the Swiss ski resort where witnesses say the ceiling caught fire, describing scenes of panic as revellers rushed to get out. Reporter Syan Vallance reports from Crans-Montana. description: Several people have reportedly been killed in Iran amid violent clashes between protesters and police. Widespread unrest over rising costs of living has shut down major cities this week. title: Mother identified as one of four drowning victims, ocean searches ongoing | ABC NEWS
description: Four people have drowned in separate incidents along the New South Wales coast in the past three days.  Melissa Austin from Berowra Heights died at Dunbogan Beach while trying to save her child from a rip current.  Authorities are searching for a 14-year-old boy who went missing at Palm Beach, and a man in his 20s at Coogee. title: Graziers in Qld tally livestock losses after flood disaster | ABC NEWS
description: The Queensland government has announced a $2m emergency fodder support package for graziers in the state's north-west after unrelenting heavy rainfall flooded much of the area. The Bureau of Meteorology says the system in the north-west is weakening and moving south, while the system on the coast should shift offshore early next week. title: NT to introduce Voluntary Assisted Dying legislation in 2026 | ABC NEWS
description: The Northern Territory government says it will introduce voluntary assisted dying (VAD) legislation to parliament this year, nearly three decades after the Commonwealth vetoed the NT's world-first euthanasia legislation in 1997. Attorney-General Marie-Clare Boothby said the NT government was now drafting legislation, with the bill to be introduced to parliament mid-2026. "Legislating for the rights of the terminally ill is one of the most sensitive and complex reforms any government can undertake," Ms Boothby said in a statement. "We're taking the time to get this right." By Joseph Hathaway-Wilson for ABC News Northern Territory.
